Articles.Content: I did good, right? The entire thing tipped, silly Kerbal X. Send a base, rover, or rescue?
Ooor... Check infinite EVA fuel and no crash damage, then send one of them straight down to Kerbin

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/91996-Lander-Legs

Try some of these suggestions with a modified kerbal-x (add a probe and an RTG, empty the capsule).

If you struggle to land consistently with that ship design, add some radial fuel tanks and widen your landing base (generally good to do anyway). :-)
Rainbow wants people to step on me!!!! Nice landing.
build a craft with 3 claws, and pluck them each from the surface without ever touching the ground.

build a craft with 3 claws, and pluck them each from the surface without ever touching the ground.

Yes.

Then, just because you can, send up more Mk1_2 pods, and start a Mars One look alike base.

If your early landings don't create a crater, then you're well ahead of the curve.

I had twenty Kerbals on the Mun before I managed to get one back off again.

Edited August 28, 2014 by Wanderfound
You're building a colony; you just didn't know it. Needs more parts!

Studies show that kerbals, when stranded, prefer the term "base" rather than "graveyard".

10characters.

Edited August 28, 2014 by Rainbowtrout

build a craft with 3 claws, and pluck them each from the surface without ever touching the ground.

<iframe width="420" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/W9t5ZqeHcYk" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

''The claw's our master! The claw chooses who will go and who will stay!''
Any landing is a landing if you can walk away!

http://i.imgur.com/I90mtPF.jpg

I did good, right? The entire thing tipped, silly Kerbal X. Send a base, rover, or rescue?

Send a rescue with a better ship. Kerbal X is terrible >.<

Gladly kerbals allways pack enough card games and snacks to survive for a small eternity. Plenty of time to rethink some landing techniques and get back to them with a rescue mission. Congratulations on your landing, by the way.

Send a nuclear ship and tell them to get into it, it'll take them home safely.

Then take them to Minmus.

Any landing is a landing if you can walk away!

Any landing you can walk away from is a good landing...

Any landing that you can re-use the spacecraft is a great landing

You're building a colony; you just didn't know it. Needs more parts!

Ha, yeah exactly. Some see a crash, we see a moon base.

Ha, yeah exactly. Some see a crash, we see a moon base.

We are happy to anounce that our first Mun landing has also become the first Mun base, the landing legs, engine and fuel tank worked well as crumble zone.

I've established so many bases by either landing with a ship that turned out not to have enough fuel to get back to orbit (like when I tried setting my Mun lander down on Eve) or I just didn't want to leave because it took so long to get there (Eeloo). Or because the ship broke into tiny little bits when it hit the ground at a perfectly reasonable speed. In fact, I've only ever established two bases that I actually had planned to make into permanent bases before arriving at the planet- One was just a Hitchhiker with some parachutes and RCS strapped to it that I dropped onto Laythe on my way past, and the other was a big KSPI fuel generation facility that I set down on Minmus, which proceeded to only last a few minutes because launching the next flight broke the save.

With enough imagination, anything can be a base.

"Jeb, why is there a spent radial decoupler sitting over there? I thought you said this was a-"

"Shut up, Bob, it's a base."
